result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas F. Higgins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The unpaid costs are to be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court by July 9, 2022.    Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim H.P.H within 30 days of sentencing and be preapprove by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with all treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Costs have been previously paid in full. Court ordered no additional costs.

The jail sentence shall begin immediately. The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County. 
Jail sentence may be served with Good Time and Huber privileges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas F. Higgins

records.addlTxt: In court notice to DE after sentencing

9:01 AM Defendant Lucas F. Higgins in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Lucas F. Higgins.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. No corrections to the revocation packet. Statement made by Attorney Tlusty. Attorney Tlusty recommends 90 days in jail with 52 days of credit. Attorney Smith makes statement. Court orders 90 days of jail time with good time and Huber privileges and 52 days credit. Court orders any unpaid fees and costs to be reduced to a civil judgment.-JN
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

03:33 PM Defendant Lucas F. Higgins in court with attorney Nicholas Grant Smith.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to count 1.    Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1. Court dismisses 22CF5.  Statement by Attorney Smith.   Court orders a withheld sentence and placement on probation for two years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation;  AODA counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Status hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.

01:09 PM Defendant Lucas F. Higgins in court with attorney Nicholas Grant Smith.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification has been complied.   Waives further reading of the complaint, charges and penalties. Plea of not guilty entered,  District attorney requests a signature bond in the amount of $350.00 and $150.00 cash;  booking.   Court sets bond as requested.  Status hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm. Pretrial conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 2:15 pm  - rt
